lead_paragraph: The strike, which Afghan intelligence said had killed the leader, indicated a major break with precedent as the United States circumvented Pakistan, which has been unable to broker peace talks with the Taliban.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jawad Sukhanyar from Kabul; Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan; Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud and Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan; Ismail Khan from Peshawar, Pakistan; David E. Sanger from Naypyidaw, Myanmar; and Eric Schmitt and Mark Mazzetti from Washington.

headline.print_headline: Strike on Chief of the Taliban Signals a Shift
headline.main: Taliban Chief Targeted by Drone Strike in Pakistan, Signaling a U.S. Shift

snippet: The strike, which Afghan intelligence said had killed the leader, indicated a major break with precedent as the United States circumvented Pakistan, which has been unable to broker peace talks with the Taliban.
abstract: Officials say American drone strike against Taliban in Pakistan's Baluchistan Province portends major shift as United States bypasses government in attempt to cripple insurgency; Afghan intelligence agency says Taliban leader Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour was killed in attack, but US cannot confirm.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
